title: "TextFooler tricks venerable NLP models like BERT into making wrong predictions"
excerpt: "While natural language processing models (NLP) have picked up pace in recent years, they are not quite there yet. And now, a team of researchers at MIT have created a framework that illustrates one instance of this. The program, dubbed TextFooler, attacks NLP models by changing specific parts of a given sentence to 'fool' them into making the ..."
